admst:assert.format: hypot function must take exactly two arguments.\n

admst:fatal.format: Illegal to use \$vt with no argument in analog function\n

admst:when.test: [name='exp' or name='ln' or name='log' or name='sqrt' or name='abs' or name='limexp' or name='cos' or name='sin' or name='tan' or name='acos' or name='asin' or name='atan' or name='cosh' or name='sinh' or name='tanh' or name='acosh' or name='asinh' or name='atanh' or name='ceil' or name='floor']

admst:warning.format: function derivative for %(name) not implemented yet!\n

admst:when.test: [name='pow' or name='min' or name='max' or name='hypot' or name='atan2']

admst:fatal.format: Unable to handle function %(name) of class %(class) at this time. Bye.
At the moment, Xyce/ADMS only supports real and integer block-local variables in analog functions\n

contributions cannot be used inside analog functions\n

admst:join.select: variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$(function))]

admst:text.format: // function that returns the total derivative of the function and its\n
// output arguments with respect to some variable. We pass in the\n
// normal arguments(none of which are used) and the derivatives of those\n
// arguments with respect to the desired variable. We compute the\n
// derivatives using the chain rule and our precomputed derivatives\n

admst:join.select: variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]
variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]
variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]

variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]

// Derivatives of return value w.r.t input vars\n
// Derivatives of additional output vars w.r.t input vars\n
// Evaluator class implementations for Analog Function %(name)\n

admst:join.select: variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$(function))]
variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]

admst:text.format: // method to get precomputed values into double vars \n

admst:join.select: variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$(function))]

admst:text.format: // Copy all precomputed values into corresponding output\n
// method to get total deriv w.r.t some variable via chain rule \n
// given precomputed derivs of function w.r.t. args and derivs of args\n

admst:join.select: variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]
variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]

admst:text.format: // method that actually performs our computations.\n

admst:join.select: variable[input='yes' or (input='no' and output='yes' and name!=$function)]
